intro: Gaertnera longivaginalis, commonly known as the long-vaginal gaertnera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its small, white to pink flowers are typically clustered in racemes and bloom during the rainy season. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
